intro: Mapania montana, commonly known as the mountain mapania, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clustered umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are finely divided and often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Mapania montana thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in montane forests and alpine meadows.
